msgSnippet: Hi, There is no version of Cactus which supports jsdk2.0.which Version of JVM you are using? I don t think ApacheJserv1.1 supports cactus. regards, Sudhir ...

Subject: RE: [junit] Unable to run the Servlet

Content-Type: text/plain;

Hi,
There is no version of Cactus which supports jsdk2.0.which Version of JVM
you are using?
I don't think ApacheJserv1.1 supports cactus.
regards,
Sudhir

-----Original Message-----
From: Sandhya Sree [mailto:sandhya.sree@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 31, 2001 12:39 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Unable to run the Servlet 


  
Hi, 
        Iam facing the problem while trying to run the Servlet using Cactus
(though i have done the complete configuration). 
       I have registered the ServletRedirector in the cactus.properties file
and still iam getting the exception as java.io.FileNotFoundException:
http://172.20.10.100/PayMate/ServletRedirector
<http://172.20.10.100/PayMate/ServletRedirector>  

Iam using  ApacheJserv1.1 ?As this  supports only Jsdk2.0,iam doubtful that
whether this tool is compatible with servlet.jar2.0? 


In log files it is showing the following error 
[31/05/2001 12:02:57:126] (ERROR) ajp12: Servlet Error:
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: javax.servlet.ServletContext: method
setAttribute(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/Object;)V not found:
javax.servlet.ServletContext: method
setAttribute(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/Object;)V not found 


From this it is clearly understandable that Jsdk2.0 which iam using doesn't
have setAttribute method  and is there any lower version of cactus which is
flexible with Jsdk2.0 


With out using higher version of Jsdk is there any solution for this? 
  
waiting for the earliest reply 
regards, 
Sandhya Sree
